content.description: Start standing on ledge. Compress and balance your way up the blunt arete.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. Landing has a few rocks and you get off the deck very quickly.
content.location: Left arete of the Amazing Pillar block.

content.description: Climb the West face of the pillar.  Fun, and a good warm up.
content.location: West face of the Amazing Pillar.

content.description: From a sit climb the nice arete trending left near the end.  Balancey and there's a cool thumb hold.  A grade easier from the stand.
content.protection: A few pads.  The landing has a good step in it.
content.location: 5 minute walk, on the same cliff band as Amazing Pillar away from the lake. Right next to The Magician and Love Triangle.

content.description: An easier way up the Slice of Life boulder. Start on the left, straddling the low corner with hands matched on the rail. Move up to the horizontal and traverse to the good holds up and right. Use a left handed sloper and a dish for the left foot to avoid beaching on the slopey and slippery topout
content.protection: flat and clean landing. A few pads
content.location: Left on the Slice of Life boulder. Look for the clean cut horizontal crack

content.description: Although squat in stature when compared to the classic routes next to it, this interesting feature has quality rock and is worth climbing. Start sitting with hands low on the face and a heel out left in the dish. Hike your weight, throw for the ledge and try to stick the crux move to the horizontal. From here move up to some good holds, step up into the crack and top out to the right. The friction in the horizontal is superb, you may actually lose some skin trying this one!
content.protection: Flat and clean landing zone, except one soccer ball size boulder. 2 pads would be optimal
content.location: A couple boulders to the right of the Amazing Pillar. Look for an obvious horizontal crack spanning a whole boulder. Crack and holds on the right are off

content.description: Fun warmup, tricky.  Climb the Right side of the face and arete.
content.location: Couple minute walk from the amazing pillar on the same cliff band away from the lake.

content.description: Starting left of Love Triangle, pull on from a sit (for me), with a right hand undercling crimp and a left sidepull crimp in a seam and power to a crimp.   From there move right, staying low, into the double aretes of Love Triangle.  This is a forced line with good moves.  The large detached blocks are not used for feet.
content.protection: A couple big pads or more.
content.location: The southern end of the Amazing Pillar cliff band.

content.description: Climb up the pretty arete from the obvious jug start.
content.location: five minute walk on the same cliff band as amazing pillar away from the lake.

content.description: Start on jug at chest height and make a couple tricky moves to get up on the face. Cool pinches and smears get you to the top.
content.location: 10 feet right of the Magician on the same cliff band.

content.description:
Named after the the shape of the rock and the heart shaped hole in a tree up and to the right of the problem, sit start with arms spread out wide and feet on detached block/s. Stand up to a slick left hand and the crux is  figuring out how to get right hand up to a smallish jug on the right (there is good beta to make the crux easier but figuring that out is half the fun). Pull up to the big jug on the apex and top it out.  

  A pretty good little problem. Using the detached block/s seems appropriate on this problem. It might be possible to do it without them but it would be really hard and probably contrived (unless you figure out some really cool beta).
content.protection: At least a couple of pads
content.location: Walk a little uphill from the Amazing Pillar. Boulder will be on the left and is hard to miss due to its triangular shape. If you're not sure, look up and to the right to see a tree with a hole shaped exactly like a heart.

content.description: Sit start on the corner just left of Love Triangle with a right-hand undercling and left-hand sidepull. Try to find feet on the actual boulder for 5 minutes or so, then give up and just use the detached block. Use good holds on the block up and to the left to top out.
content.location: Just left of Love Triangle, about 25 yards East of Amazing Pillar, on the same bluff line.

content.description: Start with good edge.  Climb the arête feature not using wall right or jamming in the crack to a slopey finish.
content.location: Wall just right of Amazing Pillar

content.description: Sit start on right side of overhanging arete with undercling and sidepull, move up bulge and topout.
content.location: East and south of Amazing Pillar.  Towards the south of the cliff band it curves east-west.  This problem is located facing south on the southernmost point of the cliffband.  An overhanging arete with 3 lines.  Area has potential for possibly a lot more.

content.description: Face and corner to the right of the Amazing Pillar.  Climb up using slopy ledges and holds in corner.  Fun warm-up
content.location: Right of the Amazing Pillar.

content.description: Sit start of left side of overhanging arete on underclings.  Move up crimps to a big move right, topout.
content.location: See directions for "GeriaTricks".  Left side of the arete.

content.description: From a sit climb up the center of the face.  Fun little thing.  Reminiscent of Horse Pens.
content.protection: Not tall and a flat landing.
content.location: Couple minute walk from the amazing pillar on the same cliff band away from the lake.

content.description: Start down low in seam and work your way up into the top of Bumboy
content.location: Left side of the Millipede boulder

content.description: From a sit in the middle of the face climb up and left on cool holds.  Good little warmup
content.location: Couple minute walk from the amazing pillar on the same cliff band away from the lake.

content.description: THE classic with the arete on the pillar. Climb up center of tall face with slab below(don't worry you'll easily clear it if you blow it)and follw crimps and rails to the top. Inspect the top out for accumulated debris first as the top out is super good if clean and scary if dirty.

On SE corner of pillar: start with left hand on large pinch, work your feet up and get small crimp on face, get your left hand up, hike feet and throw for good hold up and left.  A classic DL hard problem!  Easier for the tall in my opinion.
content.location: Main attraction at the Amazing Pillar.

content.description: Start on the face left of Amazing Pillar and climb the left side of the Amazing Pillar.  The crux is up high, make sure to have a few pads and spotters as a fall will probably put you right on a rock in the landing. I believe this is right of the Original Route but correct me if I'm wrong.
content.location: The left side of the classic Amazing Pillar.

content.description: Small area on the south side of the trail while hiking to the Reserve, with a couple of Lake classics.  Found by Eric B, and Eddy W.  Later established by the great Eric Z.
